info.title: UiTdatabank v3
info.description:
Version 3 of the UiTdatabank, a central database of cultural offers in the Flanders region.

Most operations require that you authenticate first with your UiTID.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the necessary information to create a new cultural event.

200.description: Details of the created event.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

url.description: The URL of the cultural event.

get.summary: View the details of a specific cultural event.

parameters.name: cdbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

200.description: An event detail.

get.summary: View the change log / history of a specific cultural event.

parameters.name: cdbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

200.description: The event history.

get.summary: Whether the current user has permission to update.

parameters.name: cdbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event.

200.description: has permission.

post.summary: Translate the title of a cultural event.

parameters.name: cdbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language of the translation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the title in the given language for the given cultural event.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

post.summary: Translate the description of a cultural event.

parameters.name: cdbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language of the translation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the description in the given language for the given cultural event.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the label to attach to the cultural event.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

post.summary: Add a label to multiple cultural events.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing information about the label and the cultural events.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The UUID of the image to add

delete.summary: Remove a label from a cultural event.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cultural event.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The label to remove from the cultural event.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

post.summary: Update the info of an event image.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event.

parameters.name: mediaObjectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the image media object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the image information that has to be changed.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

post.summary: Add a label to a query

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing information about the label and the query.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

parameters.name: zipcode
parameters.description: Limit the list to places located in the area with this postal code.

200.description: A list of places matching the supplied criteria.

get.summary: Retrieve all information about the current user.

200.description: The information available about the current user.

get.summary: Retrieve labels used recently by the current user.

200.description: A list of labels recently used by the current user.

get.summary: Retrieve events for a given search query with a given start and limit.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query to execute.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of events included in the result set. When omitted it defaults to 30 items.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The number of events to skip from the start of the result set.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
How to order the search results.

Specify a field and an optional direction (asc or desc) separated by a space. A list of sortable fields is available at: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y0DPDrPXNx45ePCo7N2fGknFO9AQDuf_m7dK_PpYBzM. The default order is 'lastupdated desc'.

200.description: A list of events

get.summary: Get a list of saved searches for the current user.

200.description: A list of saved searches.

post.summary: Save a search for the current user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object containing the the required information to create a new saved search.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

delete.summary: Remove a saved search for the current user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the saved search to remove.

200.description: Info on the command that was queued.

post.summary: Add a new variation of an existing event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Original URL of the event and a custom description

202.description: Info on the command that was queued.

400.description: There is an error in the request.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Limit the list to variations owned by a particular user. Specify the user's universally unique identifier.

parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: Limit the list to variations with this purpose.

parameters.name: same_as
parameters.description: Limit the list to variations of this event url.

200.description: A list of variations matching the supplied criteria.

get.summary: View the details of a specific variation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The universally unique identifier of the variation.

200.description: An event detail.

examples.calendarSummary: Every first day of the month

location.name: This is the place to be

examples.creator: evenementen@stad.diksmuide.be

410.description: The variation is no longer available, because it was removed.

404.description: The variation with the specified identifier was not found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The universally unique identifier of the variation.

202.description: Info on the command that was queued.

410.description: The variation is no longer available, because it was removed.

404.description: The variation with the specified identifier was not found.

403.description: The user is not allowed to delete this variation.

patch.summary: Patch properties of an existing variation

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The universally unique identifier of the variation.

202.description: Info on the command that was queued.

400.description: There is an error in the request.

410.description: The variation is no longer available, because it was removed.

404.description: The variation with the specified identifier was not found.

403.description: The user is not allowed to patch this variation.

calendarSummary.example: Every first day of the month

addressCountry.description: The country code of the location.

addressLocality.description: The locality name of the location.

streetAddress.description: The street name and number information of the location.

bio.example: Alberto Contador is a Spanish professional cyclist, one of six riders to have won all three Grand Tours of road cycling.

name.example: This is the place to be

items.description: A universally unique identifier for a cultural event.
A universally unique identifier for a cultural event.

description.example: This is a description of a cultural event.
This is a description of a place.

owner.description: The universally unique identifier of the owner of the variation. Currently, only the current user's id is supported.

purpose.description: A string describing the purpose of the variation.

same_as.description: URL of the event to create a variation of.

description.description: The alternative description of the event.
description.example: William Kentridge keert terug naar de Met voor zijn eerste nieuwe productie sinds de première door het gezelschap van The Nose, een opera die voor ophef zorgde bij de opening in 2010. Deze vindingrijke visuele kunstenaar regisseert het schokkende meesterwerk van Berg over een seksueel onweerstaanbare jonge vrouw die met haar losbandige gedrag de ondergang teweegbrengt van al wie zich door haar laat bekoren.

description.description: The alternative description of the event.

Deze vindingrijke visuele kunstenaar regisseert het schokkende meesterwerk van Berg over een seksueel onweerstaanbare jonge vrouw die met haar losbandige gedrag de ondergang teweegbrengt van al wie zich door haar laat bekoren.

type.description: One of the event types available at: http://taxonomy.uitdatabank.be/api/domain/eventtype/classification

theme.description: One of the available themes from http://taxonomy.uitdatabank.be/api/domain/theme/classification

domain.description: This is hardcoded to 'thema' in the current application. It is passed to the API and then overwritten.

copyrightHolder.description: The name of the copyright holder.
